Noun[edit]

Oktober (plural Oktobermaande)

  1. October

Indonesian[edit]

Indonesian Wikipedia has an article on:
Oktober
Wikipedia id

Etymology[edit]

From Dutch oktober, from Latin octōber (“eighth month”), from Latin octō (“eight”), from Proto-Indo-European *oḱtṓw (“twice four”). October was the eighth month in the Roman calendar.

Pronunciation[edit]

  • IPA(key): /ɔk̚.ˈto.bər/
  • Hyphenation: Ok‧to‧bêr

Proper noun[edit]

Oktobêr

  1. October

Coordinate terms[edit]

  • (months) bulan-bulan: Januari, Februari, Maret, April, Mei, Juni, Juli, Agustus, September, Oktober, November, Desember

Further reading[edit]

  • “Oktober” in Kamus Besar Bahasa Indonesia (KBBI) Daring, Jakarta: Badan Pengembangan dan Pembinaan Bahasa, Kementerian Pendidikan dan Kebudayaan Republik Indonesia, 2016.

  • IPA(key): /okˈtoːbɐ/

Oktober m

  1. October

Malay[edit]

Alternative forms[edit]

  • اوکتوبر‎

Etymology[edit]

From English October, from Middle English, from Old English, from Latin octōber, from octō, from Proto-Indo-European *oḱtṓw.

Pronunciation[edit]

  • IPA(key): [ɔktobə(r)]
  • Rhymes: -bə(r), -ə(r)

Proper noun[edit]

Oktober (Jawi spelling اوکتوبر)

  1. October (tenth month of the Gregorian calendar)
